moves.1. e4 c5 2. Nf3 d6 3. d4 cxd4 4. Qxd4 Nc: Bishop d7 is a waste of one tempo, but, in view of winning the White Bishop, I thought maybe it is worth it.
moves.6. Bxc6: I have bad memories of taking back with the c pawn which is a tempting move to make: opening b file, creating a majority in the center after c5, etc. So I played Bxc6.
moves.6... Bxc6 7. Nc3:
White is ahead in development, and I was hesitating between e6 and e5. After the game, my opponent told me that e6 is the best theoretical reply, and during the game I also knew that e6 was better, especially that it controls d5 against Nd5 and keeps my Bc6 alive (for "whom" I've spent 1 tempi)
But knowing the player I was playing against, I did not accept giving two tempis of development gap. 
So I've played e5 with tempi, contradicting the previous plan I've made with Bd7.
moves.7... e5 8. Qd3: My opponent was playing instantly and looking around not paying attention to the board. ANd that made me more nervous.
moves.8... h6: The second contradiction. Also according to my opponent, this was wrong. But fears of Bg5, followed by 0-0-0, Bxf6 then taking the pawn at d6 convinced my mind to abandon development and restrict my opponent.
moves.9. Be3 Nf6: White was two more pieces ahead in development.
moves.10. O-O-O Ng4: Despite the dangerous development gap (Now at +3 pieces),  I thought White can't do anything: h6 secures a lot of things, Bf8 defends my weak d6, and White cannot move his Be3 away. So let's take the Bishop pair.
moves.11. Nb5:
this was a shocking move. I was expecting Rhf1, opening the f file.
White ran toward d6. And I discovered that I can't take on b5 without some fire.
moves.11... Nxe3 12. fxe3: And here I sank into minutes of thought, where I've accepted to give a pawn and secure safety for the king.
moves.12... Be7 13. Nxd6+ Bxd6 14. Qxd6 Qxd6 1: Even though White is a pawn up, d3 was weak and my Bishop was incredibly good. My opponent tried hard luring me to take on g2, and I refused, then went against my queen side pawns, and in the mean time I've won the d3 pawn, then put a rook behind his king and in a technically drawn game I managed to pull out a shocking win in round one.
